definition: number (e.g. page or house number)/numeral (e.g. Arabic or Chinese numeral)/code sign/plus or minus sound/counter/chip (e.g. in gambling games)/price tag/ready cash at one's disposal (old)
weight/number/code/to pile/to stack/classifier for length or distance (yard), happenings etc

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
Suzhou numerals, i.e. the ten numerals 〡,〢,〣,〤,〥,〦,〧,〨,〩,十 nowadays mainly used in traditional trades such as Chinese medicine/also called 草碼|草码[cao3 ma3]

sentences.english: Together, they read the genetic code and match it up to amino acids (see diagram).
sentences.chinese: 同时，他们读取基因密码子并将其与氨基酸进行匹配。
该基因由337个密码子组成。

sentences.english: Well, having babies and marrying are not, necessarily, the same thing.
sentences.chinese: 生孩子跟结婚基本上是两码子事。

sentences.english: Then, two more mutations removed the remaining stop signs.
sentences.chinese: 然后，两个以上的突变去除了剩下的终止密码子。

sentences.english: Being skeptical and seeking faults are two completely different things.
sentences.chinese: 保持怀疑和挑毛病完全是两码子事。

sentences.english: Codon usage varies throughout the animal and plant kingdoms.
sentences.chinese: 动物界和植物界密码子使用频率不同。

sentences.english: Scientists already knew that the genetic code uses a 64-letter alphabet called codons.
sentences.chinese: 科学家先前已经知道基因编码拥有64个密码子。

sentences.english: Missense mutation --- A mutation that changes a codon specific for one amino acid to specify another amino acid.
sentences.chinese: 突变成编码另一种氨基酸的密码子。

sentences.english: After two-month dating, they decided to go all the way.
sentences.chinese: 经过两个月的约会后，他们决定做那码子的事。

sentences.english: The asterisk indicates the stop codon.
sentences.chinese: 星号提示此序列为终止密码子。

sentences.english: His endless complaints are all variations on the same thing.
sentences.chinese: 他无休止的抱怨，说来说去全是同一码子事。

definition: coat/jacket/short and lined coat or robe
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
